content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

```julia
using Base.Threads

function pig_latinify(word::AbstractString)::String
    if occursin(r"^[aeiou]", lowercase(word)) 
        return word * "ay"
    else
        return word[2:end] * word[1] * "ay"
    end
end

function pig_latin_transformer(words::Vector{String})::Vector{String}
    result = Vector{String}(undef, length(words))
    Threads.@threads for i in 1:length(words)
        result[i] = pig_latinify(words[i])
    end
    return result
end
```

```julia
using Base.Threads

function pig_latinify(word::AbstractString)::String
    if occursin(r"^[aeiouAEIOU]", word)
        return word * "ay"
    else
        first_vowel_index = search(r"[aeiouAEIOU]", word)
        return word[first_vowel_index:end] * word[1:first_vowel_index-1] * "ay"
    end
end

function pig_latin_transformer(words::Vector{String})::Vector{String}
    result = Vector{String}(undef, length(words))
    Threads.@threads for i in 1:length(words)
        result[i] = pig_latinify(words[i])
    end
    return result
end
```
